CodeDefinition.gml:name: Composite Product Record

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Metadata record describing a cruise that has already taken place
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Cruise Summary record

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Metadata record describing a data series from the European Directory of the Initial Ocean Observing System
CodeDefinition.gml:name: EDIOS data series record

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Metadata record describing an observing programme from the European Directory of the Initial Ocean Observing System
CodeDefinition.gml:name: EDIOS observing programme record

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Metadata record describing a data collection platform from the European Directory of the Initial Ocean Observing System
CodeDefinition.gml:name: EDIOS platform record

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Metadata record describing a dataset from the European Directory of Marine Environmental Datasets
CodeDefinition.gml:name: EDMED record

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Metadata record describing a project in the European Directory of Marine Environmental Research Projects
CodeDefinition.gml:name: EDMERP project record

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Metadata record providing discovery metadata for a product such as a DTM which is produced following the project methodology for the construction of a final product eg a DTM delivered by partners to a regional integrator.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Intermediate Product record

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Metadata record describing a cruise that is planned for the future
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Planned Cruise record

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Metadata record providing discovery metadata for a data product
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Product record

CodeListDictionary.gml:description: Formats used for data delivery by SeaDataNet

CodeDefinition.gml:description: SeaDataNet extension of the Climate and Forecast (http://www.cfconventions.org/) standard binary format with additional semantics embedded. Designed for multidimensional series and grids.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Climate and Forecast NetCDF

CodeDefinition.gml:description: SeaDataNet extension of the Mediterrannean community ASCII format with additional semantics embedded. Designed for profiles and point time series.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: MEDATLAS ASCII

CodeDefinition.gml:description: SeaDataNet extension of the Ocean Data View ASCII upload format with additional semantics embedded. Designed for profiles and point time series.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Ocean Data View ASCII input

CodeDefinition.gml:description: A standard bit-mapped image format employing lossless compression for the storage of images.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Portable Network Graphics

CodeDefinition.gml:description: A standard data format developed by the Society of Exploration Geophysicists for exchanging seismics data (http://www.seg.org/SEGportalWEBproject/prod/SEG-Publications/Pub-Technical-Standards/Documents/seg_y_rev1.pdf).
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Society of Exploration Geophysicists SEG Y

CodeDefinition.gml:description: A standard format for the storage of images originally developed by Aldus, but under the control of Adobe Systems since 2009.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Tagged Image File Format

CodeDefinition.gml:description: A standard format designed for raw marine positioning and ancillary data exchange widely used by industry especially for seismic surveys (http://www.epsg.org/Exchange/P1.pdf).
CodeDefinition.gml:name: United Kingdom Offshore Operators Association P1-90

CodeDefinition.gml:description: A Triton Imaging Incorporated file format for recording hydrographic survey data, widely used for sidescan sonar.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: eXtended Triton Format

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Includes all parameters covering the strength of acoustic signal return, including absolute measurements of returning signal strength as well as parameters expressed as backscatter (the proportion of transmitted signal returned)
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Acoustic backscatter in the water column
Acoustic noise in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters quantifying the magnitude of earth movements resulting from artificial sources (such as explosions) far away from the measurement site.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Active seismic refraction

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Measurements of air pressure as the dependent variable (ie excluding air pressure measured to specify the z co-ordinate of a balloon or sonde), including derived parameters such as tendency (rate of change) and related parameters such as air density.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Air pressure

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters quantifying the degree of hotness of the atmosphere. Specifically excludes indirect measurements of other parameters such as wet bulb temperatures.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Air temperature

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters quantifying the hydrogen ion concentration in water bodies
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Alkalinity, acidity and pH of the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters quantifying the amount of organic compounds containing both a carboxyl group and an amino group in unlithified seabed material.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Amino acids in sediment

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Ammonium concentration parameters (including statistical parameters such as standard deviation) in the water column
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Ammonium concentration parameters in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Fluxes of chemical species from the atmosphere to sea or land surface including precipitation and aerosol deposition but excluding fluxes due to exchange of gases
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Atmospheric deposition rates

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters quantifying and describing the release of substances into the atmosphere as a result of human activity
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Atmospheric emissions

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters that either quantify the water content of moist air or are specifically used in its determination (eg wet bulb air temperature)
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Atmospheric humidity

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters quantifying and categorising the particulate phases (solids and aerosols) of the atmosphere, excluding chemical composition
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Atmospheric particulates

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters relating to atmospheric clarity, such as optical transmittance/attenuance, and resultant visibility
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Atmospheric visibility and transparency

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Any enumeration of bacteria (Kingdom Monera so includes cyanobacteria) designated by terms other than taxonomic names (e.g. total) in any soil or sediment.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Bacteria generic abundance in sediment

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Any enumeration of bacteria (Kingdom Monera so includes cyanobacteria) designated by terms other than taxonomic names (e.g. total) in any body of fresh or salt water.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Bacteria generic abundance in water bodies

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters relating to the abundance and nature of bacteria (Kingdom Monera) infecting other biota.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Bacteria in biota

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters describing the size, shape or physiological activity of bacteria, defined as Kingdom Monera (includes cyanobacteria). Includes parameters both parameters mapped to taxa and those mapped to non-taxonomic groupings.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Bacteria morphology and physiology

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Basically any bacteria carbon biomass parameters that aren't included in parameter group BATC because they cannot be mapped to specific taxa in the ITIS taxonomy. Bacteria are defined as Kingdom Monera, which includes cyanobacteria.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Bacteria non taxonomy-related biomass expressed as carbon per unit volume of the water column
Bacteria non taxonomy-related biomass expressed as protein per unit volume of the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Any enumeration of bacteria (Kingdom Monera so includes cyanobacteria) designated by taxonomic names (e.g. species, genus, family) in any soil or sediment.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Bacteria taxonomic abundance in sediment

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Any enumeration of bacteria (Kingdom Monera so includes cyanobacteria) designated by taxonomic names (e.g. species, genus, family) in any body of fresh or salt water.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Bacteria taxonomic abundance in water bodies

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Bacteria ash-free dry weight biomass in sediment parameters presented at the level of taxa that may be mapped to entities in the ITIS taxonomy. The taxa may be at any taxonomic level from sub-species upwards. Bacteria are defined as all taxa that fall into Kingdom Monera in the ITIS taxonomy, which includes cyanobacteria.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Bacteria taxonomy-related ash-free dry weight biomass in sediment

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Bacteria carbon biomass parameters presented at the level of taxa that may be mapped to entities in the ITIS taxonomy. These may be at any taxonomic level from sub-species upwards. Bacteria are defined as all taxa that fall into Kingdom Monera in the ITIS taxonomy, which includes cyanobacteria.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Bacteria taxonomy-related biomass expressed as carbon per unit volume of the water column
Bacterial consumption in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters related to bacterial production determination by measurement of dissolved organic molecule (e.g. leucine, thymidine) uptake rates
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Bacterial production in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Depth of the water column or elevation of land surface relative to sea surface, geoid or other datum
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Bathymetry and Elevation

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters describing the effects of substances on living organisms.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Bioassay and contaminant biological impact

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters describing the variety of entity types encountered in a population of living organisms
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Biodiversity indices

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters quantifying and categorising biological detritus (eg exuvia and faecal pellets) in the water column that have been derived from the water column
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Biological detritus in the water column suspended particulate material

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters describing the nature and intensity of light generated by biological activity in the water column.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Bioluminescence parameters

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Lipids are defined as small water-insoluble biomolecules including fats, fatty acids, esters, sterols, isoprenoid compounds, etc.. Biota includes any type of sample originating from a living organism.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Biota lipid concentrations

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters describing the actions or reactions of birds (Class Aves), usually in response to the environment. Includes both parameters mapped to taxa and those mapped to non-taxonomic groupings.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Bird behaviour

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters related to the reproduction of birds (Class Aves)
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Bird reproduction

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Bird (Class Aves) abundance per unit area (of land or sea) presented at the level of taxa that may be mapped to entities in the ITIS taxonomy.These may be at any taxonomic level from sub-species upwards.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Bird taxonomy-related abundance per unit area of surface

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Bird (Class Aves) count parameters presented at the level of taxa that may be mapped to entities in the ITIS taxonomy. These may be at any taxonomic level from sub-species upwards. Count includes presence/absence indicators.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Bird taxonomy-related counts

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentrations of total, organic and inorganic carbon per unit weight of sediment. Sediment is understood to be the solid phase of the bed, including the recently settled material sometimes known as fluff collected from the bed surface.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Carbon concentrations in sediment

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentrations of total, organic and inorganic carbon per unit weight of suspended particulate material collected by water column filtration, centrifugation or sediment trapping.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Carbon concentrations in suspended particulate material

CodeDefinition.gml:description: CO and CO2 concentration parameters in any phase of the atmosphere (but usuall the gaseous phase). Includes pCO2.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Carbon monoxide and dioxide concentrations in the atmosphere

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Sediment includes anything collected by a grab or corer, including the fluff layer from the top of the consolidated sediment
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Carotenoid pigment concentrations in sediment
Carotenoid pigment concentrations in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters that specify the number of specified members of Order Cetacea present at a particular time and location, including presence/absence indicators.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Cetacean abundance

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters describing the actions or reactions of cetaceans (Order Cetacea), usually in response to the environment. Includes both parameters mapped to taxa and those mapped to non-taxonomic groupings.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Cetacean behaviour

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters describing the size, shape or physiological activity including disease and parasite infection status of cetaceans (Order Cetacea). Includes both parameters mapped to taxa and those mapped to non-taxonomic groupings.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Cetacean morphology and physiology

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters describing the causes and rate of mortality in cetaceans (Order Cetacea). Includes both parameters mapped to taxa and those mapped to non-taxonomic groupings.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Cetacean mortality

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters related to the reproduction of cetaceans (Order Cetacea)
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Cetacean reproduction

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentrations of chlorofluorocarbons (also known as freons or CFCs) in sny body of water
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Chlorofluorocarbon concentrations in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Includes all variants of chlorophyll. Sediment includes anything collected by a grab or corer, including the fluff layer from the top of the consolidated sediment
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Chlorophyll pigment concentrations in sediment

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Includes all variants of chlorophyll expressed in terms of per unit volume or unit area of the water column. Does not include data expressed per unit mass of SPM.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Chlorophyll pigment concentrations in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters describing the horizontal and vertical extent of cloud cover
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Cloud cover height and extent

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters that classify cloud cover into types such as cumulus and cirrus.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Cloud type

CodeDefinition.gml:description: All parameters associated with coastal landforms such as beaches and dunes including morphology, evolution and associated transport phenomena
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Coastal geomorphology

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentrations of metal elements in the colloidal phase of the water column. Usually the dissolved concentration difference between conventionally filtered water and ultra-filtered water.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Colloidal metal concentrations in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Colloidal organic carbon per unit volume of the water column.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Colloidal organic carbon concentration in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentrations of adenylates (ADP, ATP etc) in all phases of the water column
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Concentration of adenlylates in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentrations of adenylates (ADP, ATP etc) per unit mass or unit volume of sediment (material collected by a corer including fluff)
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Concentration of adenylates in sediment

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Alkanamine concentrations in all phases of the water column
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Concentration of alkanamines (amines) in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Alkane concentrations in sediment, which is considered to be anything from the bed sampled by a grab or corer, including 'fluff'
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Concentration of alkanes in sediment samples

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Alkane concentrations in all phases of the atmosphere
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Concentration of alkanes in the atmosphere

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Alkane concentration parameters (including saturation of gaseous species) in all phases of the water column. Does not include parameters expressed per unit weight of SPM.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Concentration of alkanes in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentration of alkanols, phenols and ethers per unit mass or unit volume of sediment (material collected by a corer including fluff)
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Concentration of alkanols (alcohols), phenols and ethers in sediment

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Alkene and alkyne concentrations in all phases of the atmosphere
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Concentration of alkenes and alkynes in the atmosphere

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Alkene and alkyne concentrations in all phases of the water column
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Concentration of alkenes and alkynes in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentrations of alkenones and alkenoates in all phases of the water column
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Concentration of alkenones and alkenoates in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentrations of carbohydrates, phenols, alkanols (alcohols), aldehydes and ketones in all phases of any body of fresh or salt water
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Concentration of carbohydrates, phenols, alkanols (alcohols), aldehydes and ketones in water bodies

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentrations of carbohydrates, phenols, alkanols (alcohols), ethers,aldehydes and ketones in unlithified sediment (material collected by a corer including fluff).
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Concentration of carbohydrates, phenols, alkanols (alcohols), ethers, aldehydes and ketones in sediment

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentration (not 380nm light absorption) parameters for dissolved organic matter (includes humics, yellow matter, Gelbstoff) in the water column
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Concentration of dissolved organic matter in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentrations of halogens as elements or their inorganic compounds in ice
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Concentration of inorganic halogens in ice

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentrations of halogens as elements or simple inorganic compounds (eg iodate) in sediments (anything collected by a corer including fluff
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Concentration of inorganic halogens in sediment

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentrations of halogens as elements or their inorganic compounds in all phases of sediment pore water
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Concentration of inorganic halogens in sediment pore waters

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentrations of halogens as elements or their inorganic compounds in all phases of the atmosphere.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Concentration of inorganic halogens in the atmosphere

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentrations of halogens as elements or their inorganic compounds in all phases of any body of fresh or salt water
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Concentration of inorganic halogens in water bodies

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentration parameters for inorganic sulphur species in ice
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Concentration of inorganic sulphur species in ice

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentration parameters for inorganic sulphur species in sediment (anything collected by a corer including fluff)
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Concentration of inorganic sulphur species in sediment

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentration parameters (including saturation if gaseous) for inorganic sulphur species in all phases of sediment pore waters
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Concentration of inorganic sulphur species in sediment pore water

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentration parameters for inorganic sulphur species in suspended particulate material (anything collected by filtration or sediment trapping). Group does not include parameters expressing data per unit volume of the water column
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Concentration of inorganic sulphur species in suspended particulate material

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentration parameters (including saturation if gaseous) for inorganic sulphur species in all phases of the water column
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Concentration of inorganic sulphur species in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Nitrate concentration parameters in ice. Includes nitrate+nitrite, which is often loosely referred to as nitrate.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Concentration of nitrates in ice

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentrations of both organic (eg amines) and inorganic (eg ammonia and oxides of nitrogen) nitrogen species in all phases of the atmosphere
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Concentration of nitrogen species in the atmosphere

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentrations of nucleic acids (DNA, RNA etc.) per unit mass or unit volume of sediment (material collected by a corer including fluff)
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Concentration of nucleic acids in sediment

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters quantifying the amount of cell nucleus material (RNA, DNA, gene copies) in any body of salt or fresh water.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Concentration of nucleic acids in water bodies

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters quantifying the proportion of organic material in a soil or sediment sample
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Concentration of organic matter in sediments

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters quantifying uncategorised organic substance concentrations in atmospheric, generally aerosol, samples such as organic matter and DOC.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Concentration of organic matter in the atmosphere

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentration parameters for organic sulphur species in ice
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Concentration of organic sulphur species in ice

CodeDefinition.gml:description: 'Other' (not alkanes, alkenes, alkynes or PAHs) hydrocarbon concentration parameters (including saturation of gaseous species) in all phases of the atmosphere.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Concentration of other hydrocarbons in the atmosphere

CodeDefinition.gml:description: 'Other' (not alkanes, alkenes, alkynes or PAHs) hydrocarbon concentration parameters (including saturation of gaseous species) in all phases of the water column. Does not include parameters expressed per unit weight of SPM.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Concentration of other hydrocarbons in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentration parameters for carbon compounds regarded as environmentally harmful in either whole organisms or their constituent parts that are not included in other categories
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Concentration of other organic contaminants in biota

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentration parameters for carbon compounds regarded as environmentally harmful in sediment, which is considered to be anything from the bed sampled by a grab or corer, including 'fluff' that are not included in other specific categories
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Concentration of other organic contaminants in sediment samples

CodeDefinition.gml:description: 'Other' organic contaminant (substances regarded as harmful other than PCBs and PAHs) concentrations in suspended particulate material, regarded as anything sampled by a water bottle, SAP, sediment trap etc. This group is for SPM composition measurements (concentration per unit weight) and NOT concentrations per unit volume of the water column in the particulate phase.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Concentration of other organic contaminants in suspended particulate material

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters quantifying concentrations of organic contaminants (substances regarded as harmful) other than PCBs and PAHs in all phases of the atmosphere
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Concentration of other organic contaminants in the atmosphere

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentration parameters for carbon compounds regarded as environmentally harmful in solution or suspension (i.e.includes measurements in both the dissolved and particulate phases) in any body of salt or fresh water that are not included in other specific categories
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Concentration of other organic contaminants in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: 'Other' (than metals or organic contaminants) substance concentrations in either whole organisms or their constituent parts. This is a 'bucket' grouping that may be reclassified as the dictionary developes.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Concentration of other substances in biota

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters associated with the concentration of algae-generated toxins in either whole organisms or their constituent parts
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Concentration of phycotoxins in biota

CodeDefinition.gml:description: PCB concentrations in either whole organisms or their constituent parts
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Concentration of polychlorobiphenyls (PCBs) in biota

CodeDefinition.gml:description: PCB concentrations in sediment, which is considered to be anything from the bed sampled by a grab or corer, including 'fluff'
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Concentration of polychlorobiphenyls (PCBs) in sediment samples

CodeDefinition.gml:description: PCB concentrations in suspended particulate material, regarded as anything sampled by a water bottle, SAP, sediment trap etc. This group is for SPM composition measurements (concentration per unit weight) and NOT concentrations per unit volume of the water column in the particulate phase.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Concentration of polychlorobiphenyls (PCBs) in suspended particulate material

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters quantifying polychlorobiphenyl (PCB) concentrations in all phases of the atmosphere
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Concentration of polychlorobiphenyls (PCBs) in the atmosphere

CodeDefinition.gml:description: PCB concentrations in all phases of the water column. This group excludes SPM composition measurements (concentration per unit weight).
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Concentration of polychlorobiphenyls (PCBs) in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: PAH concentrations in either whole organisms or their constituent parts
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Concentration of polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons (PAHs) in biota

CodeDefinition.gml:description: PAH concentrations in sediment, which is considered to be anything from the bed sampled by a grab or corer, including 'fluff'
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Concentration of polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons (PAHs) in sediment samples

CodeDefinition.gml:description: PAH concentrations in suspended particulate material, regarded as anything sampled by a water bottle, SAP, sediment trap etc. This group is for SPM composition measurements (concentration per unit weight) and NOT concentrations per unit volume of the water column in the particulate phase.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Concentration of polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons (PAHs) in suspended particulate material

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters quantifying polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbon (PAH) concentrations in all phases of the atmosphere
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Concentration of polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons (PAHs) in the atmosphere

CodeDefinition.gml:description: PAH concentrations in all phases of the water column. This group includes concentrations per unit volume of the water column in the particulate phase, but not concentrations per unit wieght of SPM.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Concentration of polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons (PAHs) in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentrations of proteins per unit mass or unit volume of sediment (material collected by a corer including fluff)
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Concentration of proteins in sediment

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentrations of proteins in all phases of the water column
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Concentration of proteins in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentration parameters for silicon species (including opal) in sediment (anything collected by a corer including fluff)
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Concentration of silicon species in sediment

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentration parameters for silicon species (including opal) in SPM (material gathered by filtration or sediment trapping). Only includes parameters expressed per unit mass of SPM and not per unit volume of the water column
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Concentration of silicon species in suspended particulate material

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentration parameters for silicon species (including opal) in all phases of the water column
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Concentration of silicon species in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters quantifying SPM concentration in the water column by weight, by volume or in terms of turbidity
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Concentration of suspended particulate material in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters quantifying the concentration of acids containing a carboxyl (-C(=O)OH) group, their anions or their salts in any phase of the atmosphere
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Concentrations of carboxylic acids and carboxylates in the atmosphere

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters quanitifying the transfer of substances considered harmful from land to sea, including river discharge rates of contaminant species (but not freshwater discharge rates).
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Contaminant fluxes between the terrestrial and marine environment

CodeDefinition.gml:description: All date and time parameters
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Date and time

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Absolute determinations of water column density plus parameters (generally expressed as density anomaly) derived from temperature and salinity
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Density of the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters characterising the environment in which sediments were deposited either by observation or interpretation of sedimentary rocks and unlithified sediments.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Depositional environment

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Determinations of the abundance of diatom remains in sediment linked to taxonomic identifications that may be mapped to entities in the ITIS taxonomy. These may be at any taxonomic level from sub-species upwards
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Diatom taxonomy-related abundance per unit mass of sediment

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters quantifying the amount of organic compounds containing both a carboxyl group and an amino group dissolved in a body of water.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Dissolved amino acid concentrations in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: All concentration parameters for inorganic dissolved gases other than oxygen and the noble gases in sediment pore water samples
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Dissolved concentration parameters for other gases in sediment pore waters

CodeDefinition.gml:description: All concentration parameters for inorganic dissolved gases other than oxygen and the noble gases in the water column
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Dissolved concentration parameters for other gases in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters related to the rates of TCO2 production and consumption based on light/dark bottle incubations
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Dissolved inorganic carbon production and respiration in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Total concentration of all dissolved inorganic nitrogen species in the water column, usually derived by summation of individual nutrient concentrations (NO3+NO2+NH4). Some workers may also include urea.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Dissolved inorganic nitrogen concentration in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentrations of metal elements in the dissolved phase of the water column. This may include a contribution from the particulate phase if this has not been totally removed by filtration and the metal in question is reactive (ie detected as if it were dissolved) to the analytical technique used.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Dissolved metal concentrations in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: All concentration parameters including saturations and statistics such as standard deviations
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Dissolved noble gas concentration parameters in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: DOC per unit volume of the water column. Note that this includes some parameters that are strictly defined as total carbon, because the water was unfiltered on the assumption that POC was negligible.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Dissolved organic carbon concentration in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentrations of dissolved organic carbon in sediment pore waters
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Dissolved organic carbon concentrations in sediment pore waters

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Any parameter relating to the rate of DOC concentration change in the water column
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Dissolved organic carbon uptake and production in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: All concentration parameters (including saturation) for dissolved oxygen in sediment pore waters
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Dissolved oxygen concentration parameters in sediment pore waters

CodeDefinition.gml:description: All dissolved oxygen parameters (including saturation and utilisation) for the water column
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Dissolved oxygen parameters in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentration of total (organic plus inorganic) or organic dissolved nitrogen per unit volume of the water column. Grouped together as organic nitrogen frequently determined as total nitrogen.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Dissolved total and organic nitrogen concentrations in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentration of total (organic plus inorganic) or organic dissolved phosphorus per unit volume of the water column. Grouped together as organic phosphorus frequently determined as total phosphorus.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Dissolved total or organic phosphorus concentration in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentration parameters for trace metalloid elements in the dissolved phase of the water column. This may include a contribution from the particulate phase if this has not been totally removed by filtration and the metal in question is reactive (ie detected as if it were dissolved) to the analytical technique used. Trace metalloids are considered as B, Ge, As, Sb, Te and Po (but not Si which is classed separately because of its major role in environmental chemistry)
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Dissolved trace metalloid concentrations in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Distribution coefficients of species between the dissolved and particulate phases of the water column
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Distribution coefficients in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters quantifying the flow of electrical current through or the electrical resistance of a body of water at any point between the bed and the atmosphere
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Electrical conductivity of the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Technical parameters that provide information on how well an instrument or data acquisition system is working
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Engineering parameters

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Includes all parameters relating to all mechanisms of waste release except respiration.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Excretion rate parameters in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Any fauna (class Animalia) abundance per unit are of sea, river or lake bed. Broad group overlapping a number of more specific groups that should be used preferentially, but this group is provided as an alternative to one-to-many mappings.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Fauna abundance per unit area of the bed

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters quantifying the electrical properties of geological units in the field. Includes parameters used to determine resistivity structure for shallow sediment properties, porosities and presence of hydrocarbon (CSEM), deeper crust and mantle studies (Magnetotellurics) and ore body location (polarisation).
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Field resistivity, electromagnetics and polarisation

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Paramaters that quantify the numbers of fish (Osteichthyes, Agnatha and Chrondrichthyes) at a given location in any body of salt or fresh water.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Fish abundance in water bodies

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters quantifying and describing biota take by fishing activities
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Fish and shellfish catch statistics

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters describing the actions or reactions of fish (Osteichthyes, Agnatha and Chondrichthyes), usually in response to the environment. Includes both parameters mapped to taxa and those mapped to non-taxonomic groupings.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Fish behaviour

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters quantifying the mass of fish (Osteichthyes, Agnatha and Chrondrichthyes)in total or by species per unit area or per unit volume in any body of fresh or salt water expressed in any form (e.g. wet weight, dry weight, carbon, nitrogen, etc.).
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Fish biomass in water bodies

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters related to the infection of Fish (Osteichthyes, Agnatha and Chrondrichthyes) by parasites and disease. Includes visual assesements and analytical data.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Fish disease and parasites

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Paramaters that quantify the size, shape, age and life processes (including mortality) of fish (Osteichthyes, Agnatha and Chrondrichthyes).
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Fish morphology, age and physiology

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Fish (Osteichthyes, Agnatha and Chrondrichthyes) abundance per unit volume parameters not included under FATX. Most commonly used for the generic term 'fish' that maps to multiple taxa.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Fish non taxonomy-related abundance per unit volume of the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Fish (Osteichthyes, Agnatha and Chrondrichthyes) size and shape parameters not included under FATM. Most commonly used for the generic term 'fish' that maps to multiple taxa.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Fish non taxonomy-related morphology

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Paramaters that quantify the fecundity, reproductive rates or nature of reproduction in fish (Osteichthyes, Agnatha and Chrondrichthyes).
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Fish reproduction

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Fish (Osteichthyes, Agnatha and Chondrichthyes) abundance per unit area of bed (sea, river, lake etc.) parameters presented at the level of taxa that may be mapped to entities in the ITIS taxonomy. Includes animals normally considered as planktonic if they have been returned from sediment samples.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Fish taxonomy-related abundance per unit area of the bed

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Fish (Osteichthyes, Agnatha and Chondrichthyes) ash-free dry weight biomass per unit area of bed (sea, river, lake etc.) parameters presented at the level of taxa that may be mapped to entities in the ITIS taxonomy. Includes animals normally considered as planktonic if they have been returned from sediment samples.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Fish taxonomy-related ash-free dry weight biomass per unit area of the bed

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Fish (Osteichthyes, Agnatha and Chrondrichthyes) count parameters presented at the level of taxa that may be mapped to entities in the ITIS taxonomy. These may be at any taxonomic level from sub-species upwards. Count includes presence/absence indicators.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Fish taxonomy-related counts

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters describing the extent, intensity, timing and method of fisheries
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Fishery characterisation

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters quantifying the capture of non-target species during commercial and non-commercial fishing trips
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Fishing by-catch

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Fluxes of any gaseous species from water column to atmosphere
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Gas fluxes between the water column and the atmosphere

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters that describe the the mass per unit volume of any samples of rock or unlithified sediment.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Geological sample density

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Any parameters quantifying the magnetic (e.g. magnetic susceptibility), electrical (e.g. resistivity) or acoustic (e.g. P-wave propogation speed) of sediment or rock cores and samples
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Geological sample magnetic, electrical and acoustic properties

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentrations of the elements classically regarded as major (>1% by weight as oxide: namely: Si, Ti, Al, Fe3+, Fe2+, Mg, Mn, Ca, Na, and K) plus affiliated parameters such as H2O- (adsorbed water) and H2O+ (or loss on ignition) in rocks or sediments.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Geological sample major element chemistry

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Any parameters quantifying ionising radiation emitted by cores or samples comprising rock, sediment (including surface sediment such as fluff)
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Geological sample radioactivity

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters quantifying the properties of rocks and sediments that are relevance to engineering such as physical strength and load-bearing capacity. Includes the disciplines of rock mechanics and soil mechanics.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Geotechnics

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters quantifying the flux of thermal energy within the solid Earth or between the solid Earth and water bodies or atmosphere.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Geothermal heat flow

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters relating to the measurement of the Earth's gravity field
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Gravity

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters quantifying the amount of groundwater in a given system such as aquifer water level and rate of flow of water through rock formations.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Groundwater amount

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters quantifying the chemistry of terrestrial groundwater bodies such as aquifers and waters percolating through rock formations.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Groundwater chemistry

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters specifying the physical or chemical environment of a place where an organism is found.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Habitat characterisation

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters specifying the vertical and horizontal spatial extent of the ecological character of a place where an organism is found
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Habitat extent

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters describing the location, nature and extent of objects that pose a threat to travel on the water column such as wrecks and obstructions
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Hazards to navigation

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters quantifying heat exchange between any body of water and the atmosphere
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Heat fluxes between the water column and the atmosphere

CodeDefinition.gml:description: All parameters relating to horizontal platform travel, including distance run
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Horizontal platform movement

CodeDefinition.gml:description: All forms of horizontal spatial coordinates such as lat/lon and grid references
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Horizontal spatial co-ordinates

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters expressing the velocity (including scalar speeds and directions) of water column horizontal movement, commonly termed Eulerian currents
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Horizontal velocity of the water column (currents)

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Measured or stratigraphically estimated age of ice
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Ice age

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters specifying the speed and direction of sea or land ice and the stresses associated with this motion.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Ice motion and related parameters

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters that quantify the level of industrial activity or industrial output
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Industrial activity

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters that quantify and specify material output into the environment as a result of industrial activity
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Industrial discharges

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters specifying the proportions of inorganic components (major/minor/trace elements, trace metals etc.) in sediment or rock samples. Major elements includes the H2O+ and H2O- parameters reported by convention in oxide weight per cent geochemical major element analyses.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Inorganic chemical composition of sediment or rocks

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters related to compounds containing two oxygen atoms joined by a single bond but no carbon atoms in any body of fresh or salt water.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Inorganic peroxides in water bodies

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentration of inorganic phosphorus species (element or compounds) in any phase of the atmosphere
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Inorganic phosphorus species concentrations in the atmosphere

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentration of inorganic silicon species (element or compounds) in any phase of the atmosphere
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Inorganic silicon species concentrations in the atmosphere

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Insect (Class Insecta) and earthworm (Subclass Oligochaeta) abundance per unit area of bed (sea, river, lake etc.) parameters presented at the level of taxa that may be mapped to entities in the ITIS taxonomy. Includes animals normally considered as planktonic if they have been returned from sediment samples. This parameter group has been implemented to separate predominantly freshwater taxa from predominantly marine taxa.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Insect and earthworm taxonomy-related abundance per unit area of the bed

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Insect (Class Insecta) and earthworm (Subclass Oligochaeta) abundance per unit area of the littoral zone (between spring tide high and low water) parameters.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Insect and earthworm taxonomy-related abundance per unit area of the littoral zone

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Insect (Class Insecta) and earthworm (Subclass Oligochaeta) ash-free dry weight biomass per unit area of bed (sea, river, lake etc.) parameters presented at the level of taxa that may be mapped to entities in the ITIS taxonomy. Includes animals normally considered as planktonic if they have been returned from sediment samples. This parameter group has been implemented to separate predominantly freshwater taxa from predominantly marine taxa.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Insect and earthworm taxonomy-related ash-free dry weight biomass per unit area of the bed

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Insect (Class Insecta) and earthworm (Subclass Oligochaeta) ash-free dry weight biomass per unit area of the littoral zone (between spring tide high and low water) parameters.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Insect and earthworm taxonomy-related ash-free dry weight biomass per unit area of the littoral zone

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Insecta abundance parameters presented at the level of taxa that may be mapped to entities in the ITIS taxonomy. These may be at any taxonomic level from sub-species upwards.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Insecta taxonomy-related abundance per unit volume of the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Insecta carbon biomass parameters presented at the level of taxa that may be mapped to entities in the ITIS taxonomy. These may be at any taxonomic level from sub-species upwards.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Insecta taxonomy-related biomass expressed as carbon per unit volume of the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters expressing the mean nett transport rates within the water column like Lagrangian currents. Note this is an unintentional duplicate of VDFC.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Lagrangian currents and transport rates in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters relating to land surface temperature including fire and other hot spot location
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Land surface temperature

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters relating to land (including marshes and the intertidal zone) vegetation
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Land vegetation

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Water column spectral absorption parameters
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Light absorption in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters relating to the extent of light penetration into the water column
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Light extinction and diffusion coefficients

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters describing rocks on the basis of physical characteristics such as colour, structure, mineralogy and grain size
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Lithology

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters describing the abundance and nature of material classed as refuse introduced to the environment by activities of man.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Litter abundance and type

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters relating to diseases and parasites of macroalgae (Rhodophycota, Chromphycota, Chlorophycota) and seagrass (Charophyta, Anthophyta) and damage to seagrass beds
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Macroalgae and seagrass infection and damage

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Macroalgae (Rhodophycota, Chromphycota, Chlorophycota) and seagrass (Charophyta, Anthophyta) count parameters presented at the level of taxa at any level from sub-species upwards. Count includes presence/absence indicators.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Macroalgae and seagrass taxonomy-related counts

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Any enumeration (e.g. count, number per litre) of macroalgae (seaweeds) designated by terms other than taxonomic names (e.g. total) in any fresh or salt water body.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Macroalgae generic abundance in water bodies

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameterisations of the intensity and inclination of Earth's magnetic field
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Magnetics

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters relating to human built structures on the coast or offshore and their impact on the environment.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Man-made structures

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters related to the study of human interaction with the sea through the investigation of associated physical remains, be they vessels, shore side facilities, port-related structures, cargoes, human remains or submerged landscapes
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Marine archaeology

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters quantifying the extent and nature of recreational activities in coastal waters, estuaries and their margins such as beaches.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Marine environment leisure usage

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Data parameters that carry information relating to a measured parameter such as measurement temperatures, integration depths, quantities sampled and incubation durations
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Metadata parameters

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Metal concentrations in either whole organisms or their constituent parts.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Metal concentrations in biota

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentrations of metal elements per unit weight of sediment. Sediment is understood to be the solid phase of the bed, including the recently settled material sometimes known as fluff collected from the bed surface.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Metal concentrations in sediment

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentrations of metal elements in sediment pore waters
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Metal concentrations in sediment pore waters

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentrations of metal elements in suspended particulate material collected by water column filtration, centrifugation or sediment trapping. Deprecated as semantic overlap with MTWP.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Metal concentrations in suspended particulate material

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentration of metal elements in any phase of the atmosphere
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Metal concentrations in the atmosphere

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentration parameters for metallic elements in ice and snow
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Metal concentrations in the cryosphere

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters quantifying the exchange of metalsbetween the bed (ie the sediment) and the water column sometimes termed benthic fluxes
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Metal fluxes between the bed and the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters concerned with the complexation of metals as ligands in the water column
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Metal ligand parameters in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters relating to the uptake rates of metals from the dissolved phase into the particulate phase
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Metal uptake rates in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Any enumeration (e.g. count, number per litre) of microzooplankton (free swimming heterotrophic organisms smaller than 200um) designated by terms other than taxonomic names (e.g. total) in any fresh or salt water body.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Microzooplankton generic abundance in water bodies

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters that express the consumption of the phytoplankton population by the microzooplankton. Generally the results of dilution experiments on water samples screened through a 200-micron mesh.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Microzooplankton grazing

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Basically, any microzooplankton carbon biomass measurement that isn't included in parameter group MATC. May include data integrations such as 'total microzooplankton'.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Microzooplankton non taxonomy-related biomass expressed as carbon per unit volume of the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Any enumeration (e.g. count, number per litre) of microzooplankton (free swimming heterotrophic organisms smaller than 200um) designated by taxonomic names (e.g. species, genus or family) in any fresh or salt water body.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Microzooplankton taxonomic abundance in water bodies

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Microzooplankton carbon biomass parameters presented at the level of taxa that may be mapped to entities in the ITIS taxonomy. These may be at any taxonomic level from sub-species upwards., but exclude morphological classifications such as 'heterotrophic flagellate'.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Microzooplankton taxonomy-related biomass expressed as carbon per unit volume of the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Microzooplankton surface area per unit volume of the water column parameters presented at the level of taxa that may be mapped to entities in the ITIS taxonomy. These may be at any taxonomic level from sub-species upwards.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Microzooplankton taxonomy-related biosurface area per unit volume of the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Microzooplankton biovolume parameters presented at the level of taxa that may be mapped to entities in the ITIS taxonomy. These may be at any taxonomic level from sub-species upwards.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Microzooplankton taxonomy-related biovolume per unit volume of the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Chemical analyses of minerals extracted from rocks or sediment or analysed in-situ using techniques like the electron microprobe.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Mineral chemistry

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters describing or quantifying the mineralogical composition of rocks and unlithified sediments.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Mineralogical composition

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Any parameters relating to molecular biology or genetics
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Molecular biology parameters

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters expressing depth (possibly as pressure) of an instrument on a suspended underwater mooring. These are primarily collected to monitor mooring performance by quantifying knock-down and should not be regarded as instrument z co-ordinates (accurate calibration is rare) or as sea level measurements.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Moored instrument depth

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters quantifying the uptake rate of nitrate or gaseous nitrogen by flora and fauna living in any body of salt or fresh water
CodeDefinition.gml:name: New production in water bodies

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Nitrate concentration parameters (including statistical parameters such as standard deviation) in the water column. Includes nitrate+nitrite, which is often loosely referred to as nitrate.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Nitrate concentration parameters in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Deprecated term from a misguided attempt to distinguish between NO3 and NO3+NO2 for discovery. Use parameter group NTRA instead
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Nitrate+nitrite concentration parameters in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters relating to the rate of nitrification (oxidation of reduced nitrogen such as ammonium) in the water column
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Nitrification rate in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Nitrite concentration parameters (including statistical parameters such as standard deviation) in the water column
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Nitrite concentration parameters in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentrations of total, organic and inorganic nitrogen per unit weight of sediment. Sediment is understood to be the solid phase of the bed, including the recently settled material sometimes known as fluff collected from the bed surface.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Nitrogen concentrations in sediment

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentrations of total, organic and inorganic nitrogen per unit weight of suspended particulate material collected by water column filtration, centrifugation or sediment trapping. Note that it is common practice to assume all nitrogen in SPM is organic.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Nitrogen concentrations in suspended particulate material

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Nutrient (nitrate, nitrite, ammonium, phosphate, silicate and urea) concentrations in sediment pore waters
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Nutrient concentrations in sediment pore waters

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters quantifying the exchange of nutrients between the bed (ie the sediment) and the water column sometimes termed benthic fluxes
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Nutrient fluxes between the bed and the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters associated with the measurement of ocean colour, including visible waveband satellite spectral radiometer measurements, their calibration measurements (spectral water-leaving radiance and reflectance) and chart colour estimates.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Ocean colour and earth-leaving visible waveband spectral radiation

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Includes all parameters covering the strength of electromagnetic radiation signal return, including absolute measurements of returning signal strength as well as parameters expressed as backscatter (the proportion of transmitted signal returned)
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Optical backscatter

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters relating to the rates of creation and consumption of organic sulphur compounds (such as DMS and carbonyl sulphide) in the water column
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Organic sulphur compound dynamics in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: All measurements of the quantity or mass of any organometallic compound in any living organisms or their component parts
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Organometallic species concentration parameters in biota

CodeDefinition.gml:description: All organometallic compound concentration parameters (including saturations for gaseous species) in all phases of sediments (including pore waters)
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Organometallic species concentration parameters in sediments

CodeDefinition.gml:description: All organometallic compound concentration parameters (including saturations for gaseous species) in all phases of any body of fresh or salt water
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Organometallic species concentration parameters in water bodies

CodeDefinition.gml:description: All organosulphur compound concentration parameters (including saturations for gaseous species) in all phases of the water column
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Organosulphur species concentration parameters in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Fluxes of species other than metals and nutrients between the bed (ie the sediment) and the water column sometimes termed benthic fluxes or sediment demand
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Other fluxes between the bed and the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentrations of volatile halocarbons (compounds comprising carbon atoms covalently bonded to fluorine, chlorine, bromine or iodine atoms) other than tracers (i.e. freons/chlorofluorocarbons) and contaminants in any body of fresh or salt water.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Other halocarbon concentrations in water bodies

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters relating to the rates of creation and consumption of volatile halocarbons (compounds comprising carbon atoms covalently bonded to fluorine, chlorine, bromine or iodine atoms) other than tracers (i.e. freons/chlorofluorocarbons) and contaminants in any body of fresh or salt water.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Other halocarbon dynamics in water bodies

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Bucket group for parameters that cannot be classified elsewhere
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Other meteorological measurements

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters that do not easily fit into any of the other SPM data categories.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Other physical and chemical properties of suspended particulate material

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Statistical parameters derived from wave data expressing wave properties other than height, period and direction
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Other wave statistics

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters related to the rates of oxygen production and consumption
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Oxygen production and respiration in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Ozone and oxygen concentration parameters in any phase of the atmosphere (but usually the gaseous phase)
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Ozone and oxygen concentrations in the atmosphere

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameterisations that describe climatic conditions in the past. Includes climate indices, climate indicators and indirect measurements of climate-related phenomena such as sea level and water table depth.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Palaeoclimatic indicators and parameters
Partial pressure (pCO2) and fugacity (fCO2) of carbon dioxide in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters quantifying the amount of organic compounds containing both a carboxyl group and an amino group in solids suspended in a body of water.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Particulate amino acid concentrations in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentrations of inorganic carbon in the particulate phase of the water column as extracted by a fitration technique. This is the particle-bound concentration per unit volume of the water column. Consequently, it is both a function of the SPM concentration in the water column and the concentration of inorganic carbon per unit weight of the SPM.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Particulate inorganic carbon concentrations in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentration parameters for metallic elements in the particulate phase of the water column collected by fitration, centrifugation or sediment trapping
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Particulate metal concentrations in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentrations of total and organic carbon in the particulate phase of the water column as extracted by a filtration technique. This is the particle-bound concentration per unit volume of the water column and is both a function of the SPM concentration in the water column and the concentration of carbon per unit weight of SPM. Total and organic carbon are classed together to circumvent confusion caused by total carbon data sets labelled 'POC' on the assumption that the inorganic carbon fraction is negligible
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Particulate total and organic carbon concentrations in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentrations of total and organic nitrogen in the particulate phase of the water column, which is a function of both the SPM concentration in the water column and the concentration of nitrogen per unit weight of SPM. Note that it is commonly assumed that all particulate nitrogen is organic.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Particulate total and organic nitrogen concentrations in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentrations of total and organic phosphorus in the particulate phase of the water column, which is a function of both the SPM concentration in the water column and the concentration of phosphorus per unit weight of SPM.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Particulate total and organic phosphorus concentrations in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentration parameters for trace metalloid elements in the particulate phase of the water column collected by fitration, centrifugation or sediment trapping. Trace metalloids are considered as B, Ge, As, Sb, Te and Po (but not Si which is classed separately because of its major role in environmental chemistry)
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Particulate trace metalloid concentrations in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters quantifying the magnitude of naturally occurring low frequency earth movements such as used for earthquake seismology and natural noise studies.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Passive seismic refraction

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentration parameters for substances synthesised by man to kill other life forms in either whole organisms or their constituent parts.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Pesticide concentrations in biota

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentration parameters for substances synthesised by man to kill other life forms in sediment, which is considered to be anything from the bed sampled by a grab or corer, including 'fluff'.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Pesticide concentrations in sediment

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentration parameters for substances synthesised by man to kill other life forms in either solution or suspension (i.e.includes measurements in both the dissolved and particulate phases) in any body of salt or fresh water.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Pesticide concentrations in water bodies

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Includes all variants of phaeopigment (chlorophyll degradation products). Sediment is defined as any solids collected by a corer, including fluff..
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Phaeopigment concentrations in sediment

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Includes all variants of phaeopigment (chlorophyll degradation products) expressed in terms of per unit volume or unit area of the water column. Does not include data expressed per unit mass of SPM.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Phaeopigment concentrations in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentration parameters for substances synthesised by man to modify bodily function or diagnose, cure, mitigate, treat, or prevent disease in either whole organisms or their constituent parts.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Pharmaceutical concentrations in biota

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentration parameters for substances synthesised by man to modify bodily function or diagnose, cure, mitigate, treat, or prevent disease in sediment, which is considered to be anything from the bed sampled by a grab or corer, including 'fluff'.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Pharmaceutical concentrations in sediments

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentration parameters for substances synthesised by man to modify bodily function or diagnose, cure, mitigate, treat, or prevent disease in either solution or suspension (i.e.includes measurements in both the dissolved and particulate phases) in any body of salt or fresh water.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Pharmaceutical concentrations in water bodies

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Phosphate concentration parameters (including statistical parameters such as standard deviation) in the water column
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Phosphate concentration parameters in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentrations of total, organic and inorganic phosphorus per unit weight of sediment. Sediment is understood to be the solid phase of the bed, including the recently settled material sometimes known as fluff collected from the bed surface.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Phosphorus concentrations in sediment

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentrations of total, organic and inorganic phosphorus per unit weight of suspended particulate material collected by water column filtration, centrifugation or sediment trapping.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Phosphorus concentrations in suspended particulate material

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentration of phycobolin group pigments such as phycocyanin and phycoerythrin in the water column
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Phycobolin pigment concentrations in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Any enumeration (e.g. count, abundance) of free-floating autotrophic biological entities designated by terms other than taxonomic names (e.g. microphytoplankton, ciliate, flagellate) in any body of fresh or salt water.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Phytoplankton generic abundance in water bodies

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Any parameterisation of biomass (e.g. wet weight, dry weight, carbon, nitrogen etc.) of free-floating autotrophic biological entities designated by terms other than taxonomic names (e.g. microphytoplankton, ciliate, flagellate) in any body of fresh or salt water.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Phytoplankton generic biomass in water bodies

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Any enumeration (e.g. count, abundance) of free-floating autotrophic biological entities designated by taxonomic names (e.g. species, genus, family) in any body of fresh or salt water.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Phytoplankton taxonomic abundance in water bodies

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Any parameterisation of biomass (e.g. wet weight, dry weight, carbon, nitrogen etc.) of free-floating autotrophic biological entities identified by their taxonomic names (e.g. family, genus, species) in any body of fresh or salt water.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Phytoplankton taxonomic biomass in water bodies

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Any parameterisation of cell surface area of free-floating autotrophic biological entities designated by taxonomic names (e.g. species, genus, family) in any body of fresh or salt water.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Phytoplankton taxonomic surface area in water bodies

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Any parameterisation of cell volume of free-floating autotrophic biological entities designated by taxonomic names (e.g. species, genus, family) in any body of fresh or salt water.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Phytoplankton taxonomic volume in water bodies

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Used for plankton abundance parameters where no differentiation between phytoplankton, microzooplankton or zooplankton is possible
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Plankton abundance per unit volume of the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Used for plankton carbon biomass parameters where no differentiation between phytoplankton, microzooplankton or zooplankton is possible
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Plankton biomass expressed as carbon per unit volume of the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters that describe the displacement of platforms or instruments in space relative to various origins
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Platform or instrument orientation

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters quantifying the accidental spillage of liquid or dry pollutants from vessels or marine industries. Parameters may include quantities of pollutant, areas affected and event duration.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Pollution events

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters relating to all kinds of precipitation (rain, snow, etc.) and water loss from the surface of the Earth
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Precipitation and evaporation

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentration of any chemical species in water collected from the atmosphere. Includes rain, snow, hail and fog but excludes cloud samples or snow accumulations on the ground.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Precipitation chemistry

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters associated with the quantification of primary production. This is defined as the fixation of carbon dioxide into either organic or inorganic carbon by living entities and so includes photosynthesis and calcification.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Primary production in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters quantifying the amount of liquids (e.g. ship's ballast) or solids (e.g. dredge spoil) deposited into the water column as a result of man's activities
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Quantity of material dumped

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Includes all parameters covering the strength of emitted microwave radiation return, including absolute measurements of returning signal strength as well as parameters expressed as backscatter (the proportion of transmitted signal returned)
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Radar backscatter

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters quantifying the level of radioactive emissions from in-situ geologic units
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Radiation geophysics

CodeDefinition.gml:description: All parameters associated with radioactivity in either whole organisms or their constituent parts
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Radioactivity in biota

CodeDefinition.gml:description: All parameters associated with radiocativity in the water column, including radiation counts, isotope activities and activity ratios. Activities per unit mass of SPM are included
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Radioactivity in the water column
Raw X-Ray fluorometer (XRF) output from sediment samples

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters as logged by measuring devices, including raw counts/voltages and ADCP relative velocities
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Raw current meter output parameters

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Output as logged from any type fluorometer.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Raw fluorometer output

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Raw concentration parameters from a gas analyser such as a LiCor
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Raw gas analyser output

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Direct output parameters from spectophotometric or chemical in-situ nutrient analysers
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Raw in-situ nutrient analyser output

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Raw parameters (usually membrane current and temperature) from dissolved oxygen sensors
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Raw oxygen sensor output

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Raw parameters (voltages and counts) from in-situ suspended particulate material sensors including transmissometers, nephelometers and in-situ particle sizers
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Raw suspended particulate material optical sensor output

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Direct output parameters from TS instruments such as thermosalinograph or CTD
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Raw temperature and/or salinity instrument output

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Reduction rates of any species in sediment cores
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Reduction rates in bed sediments

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Data record, event, sample or measurement reference numbers
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Reference numbers

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters quantifying the uptake rate of nitrogen from excretion products (ammonium and urea) by flora and fauna living in any body of salt or fresh water
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Regenerated production in water bodies

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters related to the abundance of reptiles (Class Reptilia)
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Reptile abundance

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters relating to diseases and parasites of reptiles (Class Reptilia)
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Reptile disease and parasites

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters related to the reproduction of reptiles (Class Reptilia)
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Reptile reproduction

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters related to the volume of water passing through a point in a river system per unit time, including the rates of freshwater, dissolved material and particulate load discharge from a river into the sea.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: River flow and discharge

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Measured or stratigraphically estimated ages of lithified sediments, igneous rock or metamorphic rock.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Rock age

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters decribing aspects of a geologic unit that are the result of bulk chemical, mineralogical or physical changes related to change in the physical or chemical environment. Includes weathering, supergene alteration, hydrothermal alteration and metasomatic effects not considered metamorphic.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Rock alteration

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters specifying the physical dimensions of the particles comprising lithified sedimentary rocks (including expressions of shape such as aspect ratio) and statistics derived from their variation in a sample (e.g. mean, mode, sorting, skewness).
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Rock grain size

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parmeters describing the space for fluids or gases within a geologic unit comprising lithified sediments, igneous rock or metamorphic rock.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Rock porosity and permeability

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters that describe the distribution of the degree of hotness within geologic units of lithified sedimentary, igneous of metamorphic rock.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Rock temperature
