CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters that describe the degree to which sedimentary, igneous or metamorphic rocks are able to conduct heat
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Rock thermal conductivity

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters quantifying the concentration of sodium chloride in any body of water at any point between the bed and the atmosphere
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Salinity of the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Measurements and predictions of the displacement of the water column surface from a fixed, stable reference
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Sea level

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Measurements of the displacement of the water column surface from a fixed, stable reference expressed as either total pressure or sea pressure
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Sea level expressed as pressure

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Digital images of the seabed obtained using either still or video cameras
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Seabed photography

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters that specify the number of specified members of Family Phocidae present at a particular time and location, including presence/absence indicators.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Seal abundance

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters describing the actions or reactions of seals (Family Phocidae), usually in response to the environment. Includes both parameters mapped to taxa and those mapped to non-taxonomic groupings.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Seal behaviour

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters describing the size, shape or physiological activity including disease and parasite infection status of seals (Family Phocidae). Includes both parameters mapped to taxa and those mapped to non-taxonomic groupings.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Seal morphology and physiology

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters describing the causes and rate of mortality of Seals (Family Phocidae). Includes both parameters mapped to taxa and those mapped to non-taxonomic groupings.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Seal mortality

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters related to the reproduction of seals (Family Phocidae)
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Seal reproduction

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Measurements of optical visibility in the water column
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Secchi disk depth

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters used to encode information specifying access rights to data, usually in terms of authorised roles
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Security tags and keys

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters quantifying the volume, mass or thickness of particulate material that gathers on the seabed per unit time.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Sediment accumulation rate

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters relating to the elucidation of sediment structure by quantifying the proportion of waves from a low energy source reflected by sub-surface layers.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Sediment acoustics

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Measured or stratigraphically estimated ages of marine sediments
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Sediment age

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters specifying the physical dimensions of the particles comprising unlithified sediment (including expressions of shape such as aspect ratio) and statistics derived from their variation in a sample (e.g. mean, mode, sorting, skewness).
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Sediment grain size parameters

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Lipids are defined as small water-insoluble biomolecules including fats, fatty acids, esters, sterols, isoprenoid compounds, etc.. Sediment is defined as material collected by a corer (including fluff).
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Sediment lipid concentrations

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters relating to the size, shape and form of microfossils in sediment samples
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Sediment microfossil morphology parameters

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters quantifying the critera for and extent of sediment resuspension
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Sediment resuspension

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters that describe the degree to which unlithified sediment is able to conduct heat
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Sediment thermal conductivity

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Sediment porosity (water content by volume) and water content by weight parameters
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Sediment water content, porosity and surface area

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters characterising structure in sedimentary rocks and unlithified sediment such as bedding, lamination and bioturbation.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Sedimentary structure
Sedimentation flux of alkenones and alkenoates in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters quantifying the amount of organic compounds containing both a carboxyl group and an amino group (including compounds such as salts and esters) sinking vertically as particles through a unit area of a water body in units time.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Sedimentation flux of amino acids and associated compounds in water bodies

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Flux of biological detritus (material derived from the water column such as exuvia and faecal pellets) in the water column
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Sedimentation flux of biological detritus in the water column
Sedimentation flux of carbohydates in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Fluxes of particulate total, organic and inorganic carbon (including as CaCO3) and nitrogen (often measured as 'total' but assumed to be 'organic'). Organic matter is defined as matter lost on ignition.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Sedimentation flux of carbon, nitrogen or organic matter in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Fluxes of any biota or remains thereof (excluding faecal pellets which are classed as SPM) downwards through the water column
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Sedimentation flux of identified biota expressed as carbon in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Fluxes expressed as number per unit area per unit time of any biota or remains thereof (excluding faecal pellets which are classed as SPM) downwards through the water column
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Sedimentation flux of identified biota in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters quantifying metal and metalloid fluxes as element concentration or isotope activities per unit area per unit time
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Sedimentation flux of metallic and metalloid elements and isotopes in water bodies

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Quantity of any inorganic species such as silicon (opal) and phosphorus passing through unit area of the water column in unit time. Carbon and nitrogen are regarded as organic and explicitly excluded
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Sedimentation flux of non-metallic inorganic species in the water column
Sedimentation flux of pigments in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Fluxes of terrestrial biological or lithological material
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Sedimentation flux of terrestrially derived material in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters expressing the total sedimentation flux in terms of particle mass, volume or counts
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Sedimentation flux quantification in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters relating to the elucidation of geological structure by quantifying the proportion of waves from a high energy source reflected by sub-surface layers.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Seismic reflection

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters relating to the elucidation of geological structure by quantifying the refration of waves from a high energy source by sub-surface layers.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Seismic refraction

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Paramaters that quantify the numbers or amount of living material of shellfish (molluscs - including cephalopods - and crustaceans of interest to fisheries research and commercial fisheries) in any body of fresh or salt water.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Shellfish abundance and biomass in water bodies

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Paramaters that quantify the size, shape, age and life processes (including mortality) of shellfish (molluscs - including cephalopods - and crustaceans of interest to fisheries research and commercial fisheries).
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Shellfish morphology, age and physiology

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Paramaters that quantify the fecundity, reproductive rates or nature of reproduction in shellfish (molluscs - including cephalopods - and crustaceans of interest to fisheries research and commercial fisheries).
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Shellfish reproduction

CodeDefinition.gml:description: A technique for mapping the morphology of the seafloor using a sonar swath projected sideways from a towed underwater vehicle.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Side-scan sonar

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Silicate concentration parameters (including statistical parameters such as standard deviation) in the water column
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Silicate concentration parameters in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Temperature of the water column surface as measured by a radiometer. It does NOT include temperature measurements in the upper few metres of the water column such as thermosalinograph data
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Skin temperature of the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters related to the chemical composition of any kind of water sample that was frozen solid at the time of sampling or measurement
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Snow and ice chemistry

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Measurements of quantity (mass), thickness and spatial extent of snow and ice
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Snow and ice mass, thickness and extent

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters related to physical properties (e.g. colour, density, in-situ temperature) or characteristics (e.g. sea ice type) of any kind of water sample that was in its solid state at the time of sampling or measurement
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Snow and ice physical properties and characteristics

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters quantifying the irradiance of the sun impinging on the Earth's surface in the visible and infra-red waveband, generally accepted as wavelengths between 300 and 3000 nm
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Solar Radiation
Sound velocity and travel time in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters for directional and non-directional spectral wave data, excluding wave directions derived from spectral data.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Spectral wave data parameters

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Measured or stratigraphically estimated ages of secondary mineral deposits in caves. This includes stalactites, stalagmites, flowstone, and crystal growths.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Speleothem age

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Stable isotope enrichment parameters from measurements on living (at the time of sampling) organisms or parts thereof
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Stable isotope enrichment in biota

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Stable isotope enrichment parameters in frozen precipitation (snow, hail, ice and slush), its accumulations (e.g. glaciers), sea ice and frozen fresh water.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Stable isotope enrichment in ice and snow

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Stable isotope enrichment parameters in sediment, including biota-associated parameters such as isotope enrichment in foraminifera tests
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Stable isotope enrichment in sediment

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters quantifying the relative proportions of stable isotopes in either the solute or solvent phase of sediment pore waters
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Stable isotope enrichment in sediment pore waters

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Stable isotope enrichment parameters in secondary mineral deposits in caves. This includes stalactites, stalagmites, flowstone, and crystal growths.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Stable isotope enrichment in speleothems

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Stable isotope enrichment parameters in both the gaseous and aerosol phases of the atmosphere
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Stable isotope enrichment in the atmosphere

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Stable isotope enrichment parameters in both the dissolved and particulate phases of the water column
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Stable isotope enrichment in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters describing or predicting water column structure plus parameters quantifying the dynamic stability of that structure
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Structure and stability of the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentration of sulphur species (element or compounds) in any phase of the atmosphere. Includes sulphur dioxide.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Sulphur species concentrations in the atmosphere

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters quantifying the amount of compounds that lower the surface tension of a liquid, the interfacial tension between two liquids, or that between a liquid and a solid in any body of salt or fresh water. The term surfactants includes detergents, wetting agents, emulsifiers, foaming agents and dispersants.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Surfactant concentrations in water bodies

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters relating to the abundance, size and morphology of particle aggregates in the SPM
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Suspended particulate material aggregates

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Includes all SPM grain size measurements and derived statistics
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Suspended particulate material grain size parameters
Suspended particulate material setting velocity parameters

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters that describe the distribution of the degree of hotness within a body of rock or unlithified sediment.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Temperature of geological units

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Temperature parameters in any body of water at any point between the bed and the atmosphere excluding the top few microns sampled by radiometers known as the skin
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Temperature of the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters expressing the variation of temperature in the water column either as a function of space or of time
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Temperature variation in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters quantifying and categorising terrestrially-derived detritus (eg dust and pollen) in the water column
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Terrestrial detritus in the water column suspended particulate material

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters relating to the mapping of terrestrial features, including coastlines
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Terrestrial mapping

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters relating to the water held by land masses such as soil and vegetation moisture content
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Terrestrial water content

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters relating to structure beneath sea-bed determined by the reflection of seismic energy along multiple parallel tracks.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Three-dimensional seismic reflection
Total dissolved inorganic carbon (TCO2) concentration in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Carbonate system parameters (DIC/TCO2, pH, alkalinity, pCO2) in sediment pore waters
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Total dissolved inorganic carbon (TCO2) in sediment pore waters

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentration parameters for metal elements in the combined dissolved and particulate phases of any body of fresh or salt water.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Total metal concentrations in water bodies

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentration parameters for trace metalloid elements in either whole organisms or their constituent parts. Trace metalloids are considered as B, Ge, As, Sb, Te and Po (but not Si which is classed separately because of its major role in environmental chemistry)
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Trace metalloid concentrations in biota

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentration parameters for metalloid elements in sediment. Sediment is understood to be the solid phase of the bed, including the recently settled material sometimes known as fluff collected from the bed surface. Metalloids are considered as B, Ge, As, Sb, Te and Po (but not Si which is classed separately because of its major role in environmental chemistry)
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Trace metalloid concentrations in sediment

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Concentration parameters for trace metalloid elements in water occupying the space between sediment grains. Trace metalloids are considered as B, Ge, As, Sb, Te and Po (but not Si which is classed separately because of its major role in environmental chemistry)
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Trace metalloid concentrations in sediment pore water

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters relating to the rate of electromagnetic radiation intensity decrease as it travels through the water column
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Transmittance and attenuance of the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters quantifying the level of activity moving people or cargo from one place to another.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Transport activity

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters describing the transport of material, heat or energy in the water column
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Transport in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Measured parameters expressing turbulence in the water column plus parameters derived from these measurements
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Turbulence in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters relating to structure beneath sea-bed determined by the reflection of seismic energy along a single track.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Two-dimensional seismic reflection

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters relating to the intensity of ultra-violet radiation in either the atmosphere or the water column
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Ultra-violet (UV) radiation

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Includes all pigments that cannot be explicitly classified as chlorophylls, phaeopigments or carotenoids (usually groups of pigments). Sediment includes anything collected by a grab or corer, including the fluff layer from the top of the consolidated sediment.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Unclassified pigment concentrations in sediment

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Includes all pigments that cannot be explicitly classified as chlorophylls, phaeopigments or carotenoids. Generally, these are parameters where different pigments have been grouped together. Concentrations are expressed in terms of per unit volume or unit area of the water column. Does not include data expressed per unit mass of SPM.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Unclassified pigment concentrations in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: The identity of the parameter is not declared. Covers cases such as internal working parameters and dummy channels.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Unspecified

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Uptake of nutrients other than nitrogen species (ie phosphate and silicate) by the water column
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Uptake of other nutrients in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Urea concentration parameters (including statistical parameters such as standard deviation) in the water column
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Urea concentration parameters in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters measured by variable fluorescence instruments such as pump and probe and fast repetition rate fluorometers
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Variable fluorescence parameters

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters quantifying the upward and downward motion of objects mounting sensors or collecting samples.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Vertical platform movement

CodeDefinition.gml:description: All vertical spatial parameters including depth, height and pressure when used as an independent variable.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Vertical spatial coordinates

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Vertical water movement parameters including non-directional speeds
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Vertical velocity of the water column (currents)

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Any enumeration (e.g. count, number per square metre) of viruses in any body of fresh or salt water.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Virus abundance in water bodies

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Includes visible waveband measurements at discrete wavelengths and PAR integrated values as photon and energy fluxes. Does not include satellite radiometer and associated calibration parameters (e.g. water-leaving radiance and reflectance)
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Visible waveband radiance and irradiance measurements in the atmosphere

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Includes measurements at discrete wavelengths and PAR integrated values, measurements as photon and energy fluxes.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Visible waveband radiance and irradiance measurements in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Lipids are defined as small water-insoluble biomolecules including fats, fatty acids, esters, sterols, isoprenoid compounds, etc.. Water body includes any body of fresh or salt water. As lipids are insoluble in water the concencentrations are associated with the particulate phase.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Water body lipid concentrations

CodeDefinition.gml:description: A measure of the tendency of any body of fresh or salt water to either gain or lose electrons when it is subject to change by introduction of a new species.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Water body redox potential

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters describing the amount in a sample of a tracer (rhodamine, SF6, 3He, etc.) that has been purposely released into a water body to track water mass movements or quantify exchanges with the atmosphere.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Water body released tracers

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Digital images of the water column obtained using either still or video cameras
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Water column photography

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters quantifying fauna and flora that indicate physical or chemical conditions in the water column such as colonisation depths and abundance of indicator species.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Water quality bioindicators

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Direct measurements (including visual estimates) plus statistically derived parameters
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Wave direction

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Statistical parameters derived from wave records to express wave height and period.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Wave height and period statistics

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Measurements of wave height that are not based on the statistical analysis of wave records, such as heave, surface roughness and visual height estimates
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Wave height estimates

CodeDefinition.gml:description: All parameters pertaining to wind velocity in either cartesian or polar co-ordinates. Units are a watchpoint as some codes specify knots.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Wind speed and direction

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters related to forces due to interactions between atmosphere and the surface of the earth or between atmospheric air masses
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Wind stress and shear

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Any enumeration (e.g. count, number per square metre) of animals living on or near the seabed designated by terms other than taxonomic names (e.g. total).
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Zoobenthos generic abundance

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Any zoobenthos wet weight biomass per unit area of the seabed parameters that are not included in parameter group ZWTX.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Zoobenthos non taxonomy-related wet weight biomass per unit area of the bed

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters indicating the health of zoobenthos taxa, such as fecundity, egg condition, presence of parasites/diseases etc.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Zoobenthos physiological condition parameters

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Any enumeration (e.g. count, number per square metre) of animals living on or near the seabed designated by taxonomic names (e.g. species, genus).
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Zoobenthos taxonomic abundance

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Any quantification of the dry mass of zoobenthos (animals living on,in or near the bed of any water body) designated by taxonomic names (e.g. species, genus). Includes animals normally considered planktonic if collected in sediment and data expressed ash-free and in terms of carbon, nitrogen etc..
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Zoobenthos taxonomic dry weight biomass

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Any zoobenthos abundance per unit area of the littoral zone (between spring tide high and low water) parameters that are not fish or terrestrial animals (insecta/oligochaeta)
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Zoobenthos taxonomy-related abundance per unit area of the littoral zone

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Any zoobenthos ash-free dry weight biomass per unit area of the littoral zone (between spring tide high and low water) parameters that are not fish or terrestrial animals (insecta/oligochaeta)
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Zoobenthos taxonomy-related ash-free dry weight biomass per unit area of the littoral zone

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Zoobenthos count parameters presented at the level of taxa that may be mapped to entities in the ITIS taxonomy. These may be at any taxonomic level from sub-species upwards. Count includes presence/absence indicators.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Zoobenthos taxonomy-related counts

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Zoobenthos wet weight biomass per unit area parameters presented at the level of taxa that may be mapped to entities in the ITIS taxonomy. Includes animals considered as planktonic if they have been returned from sediment samples.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Zoobenthos taxonomy-related wet weight biomass per unit area of the bed

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Development stage parameters (such as proportion but excluding abundance or biomass) of zooplankton and zoobenthos. Benthic and planktonic animals have not been seggregated because there is a degree of overlap (eg shrimps).
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Zooplankton and zoobenthos development stage parameters

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Morphological parameters of zooplankton and zoobenthos (essentially any animal except for insects, earthworms or fish), such as size, shape and weight. Benthic and planktonic animals have not been seggregated because there is a degree of overlap (eg shrimps).
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Zooplankton and zoobenthos morphological parameters

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Zooplankton (mesozooplankton and larger, exclusing fish, mammals, reptiles and insects) biomass determined by gravimetric measurement of loss on ignition
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Zooplankton ash-free dry weight biomass per unit volume of the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Integrated zooplankton (mesozooplankton and larger, exclusing fish, mammals, reptiles and insects) carbon biomass parameters
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Zooplankton carbon biomass per unit area of the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Chemical composition of zooplankton expressed in terms of mass (or molar quantity) per specimen or per unit tissue mass
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Zooplankton chemical composition

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Faecal pellet production and gut evacuation rates
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Zooplankton defecation rates in the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Zooplankton (mesozooplankton and larger, exclusing fish, mammals, reptiles and insects) biomass determined by drying to constant weight.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Zooplankton dry weight biomass per unit volume of the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters quantifying the ingestion of food by zooplankton (mesozooplankton and larger but excluding fish) in terms of identified biota or chemical species and the effects of nutrition on life processes such as physiology and reproduction.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Zooplankton feeding

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters pertaining to zooplankton growth rates including biochemical proxies such as AARS activity
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Zooplankton growth rates

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Parameters identifying or quantifying zooplankton gut pigments
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Zooplankton gut pigments

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Zooplankton (mesozooplankton plus larger pelagic animals excluding fish, reptiles and mammals) abundance per unit volume parameters not included in group ZATX. Usually used for generic names such as 'mesozooplankton'.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Zooplankton non taxonomy-related abundance per unit volume of the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Zooplankton (mesozooplankton plus larger pelagic animals excluding fish, reptiles and mammals) carbon biomass per unit volume parameters not included in group ZCTC. Usually used for generic names such as 'mesozooplankton'.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Zooplankton non taxonomy-related biomass expressed as carbon per unit volume of the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Zooplankton (mesozooplankton plus larger pelagic animals excluding fish, reptiles and mammals) nitrogen biomass per unit volume parameters not included in group ZCTC. Usually used for generic names such as 'mesozooplankton'.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Zooplankton non taxonomy-related biomass expressed as nitrogen per unit volume of the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Zooplankton (mesozooplankton plus larger pelagic animals excluding fish, reptiles and mammals) protein biomass per unit volume for entities that have not been identified by taxonomic name
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Zooplankton non taxonomy-related biomass expressed as protein per unit volume of the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: All parameters related to zooplankton reproduction rates
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Zooplankton reproduction rate parameters

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Zooplankton (mesozooplankton plus larger pelagic animals excluding fish, reptiles and mammals) abundance parameters presented at the level of taxa that may be mapped to entities in the ITIS taxonomy. These may be at any taxonomic level from sub-species upwards.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Zooplankton taxonomy-related abundance per unit volume of the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Zooplankton (mesozooplankton plus larger pelagic animals excluding fish, reptiles and mammals) carbon biomass parameters presented at the level of taxa that may be mapped to entities in the ITIS taxonomy. These may be at any taxonomic level from sub-species upwards.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Zooplankton taxonomy-related biomass expressed as carbon per unit volume of the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Zooplankton (mesozooplankton plus larger pelagic animals excluding fish, reptiles and mammals) nitrogen biomass parameters presented at the level of taxa that may be mapped to entities in the ITIS taxonomy. These may be at any taxonomic level from sub-species upwards.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Zooplankton taxonomy-related biomass expressed as nitrogen per unit volume of the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Zooplankton (mesozooplankton plus larger pelagic animals excluding fish, reptiles and mammals) protein biomass per unit volume for entities that have been identified by taxonomic name
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Zooplankton taxonomy-related biomass expressed as protein per unit volume of the water column

CodeDefinition.gml:description: Zooplankton (mesozooplankton and larger, exclusing fish, mammals, reptiles and insects) biomass determined by weighing unprocessed catch samples.
CodeDefinition.gml:name: Zooplankton wet weight biomass
